org.usfirst.frc.team2077.video.interfaces

Interface RenderedView

  • All Superinterfaces:
    VideoView
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultView

    public interface RenderedView
extends VideoView
    Displayable or exportable view directly comprised of Rendering objects. Each rendering manages the projection of pixel data from one VideoSource.

    Views are created by Main and are required to have a constructor taking parameter (String name), where name is its configuration property prefix.

    Â© 2018

    Author:
    FRC Team 2077, R. A. Buchanan

    • Method Detail

      • getRenderings

        java.util.Collection<Rendering> getRenderings()
        Returns:
        All renderings in this view.

      • getLayoutMask

        java.awt.image.BufferedImage getLayoutMask()
        Returns:
        Color coded mask image. This image is used to allocate pixels in the view to one and only one rendering in cases where multiple renderings in the view may overlap. Each rendering is assigned its own mask-color property, and will update only those view pixels whose coordinates correspond to a matching color in the mask image.

      • processFrame

        void processFrame(java.nio.IntBuffer sourcePixels,
                  int[] renderingSourceMap)
        Parameters:
        sourcePixels - Pixel data from the latest frame update from a video source feeding this view.
        renderingSourceMap - A list of pixel index pairs mapping source frame pixels to view pixels.

      • isLive

        boolean isLive()
        Returns:
        Indicates view is in use and needs to receive source frame updates

      • setLive

        void setLive(boolean live)
        Parameters:
        live - Marks view as in use and needing to receive source frame updates.
